group_1.textCenter: Kako can decide what to play today.
I'm tired from all the shouting, I need a break…

group_1.textRight: (I looked into Felicia a little bit…)

group_1.textLeft: Felicia, the girl who lived on the 15th floor?!

group_1.textRight: Um, do you know what happened to her…?

group_1.textLeft: I wish I could tell you.
I don't know if she ran off in the night or what,@but she suddenly left without even a farewell…
On top of that, just between you and me…@The manager told me something strange.
It seems ONLY the inside of the room was@on fire.
There was no sign of smoke outside, and the@exterior was perfectly fine!
After that, rumors began to spread and@everyone started feeling uncomfortable.
A lot of people moved out, too.
Every room on the 15th floor is empty now.

group_1.textRight: …Felicia must have had to confront a harsh@reality.
But she became stronger because of that,@didn't she…?

group_1.textLeft: Yes…

group_1.textRight: Let's keep going…

group_1.textLeft: Oh, this is Shizuku's cafe…

group_1.textRight: Yes, it's her family's coffeehouse…

group_1.textLeft: Are we going there now…?

group_1.textRight: Yes…
It's on the road leading directly to Electric Town.
Now that Ryo and Ikumi have passed away,@to keep recording Magical Girls,
I can't avoid interviewing Miss Shizuku…

group_1.textLeft: …That's true, but…

group_1.textRight: Do you feel uncomfortable?

group_1.textLeft: I'm worried about her…@But I'm also scared to see her…

group_1.textRight: Why is that…?

group_1.textLeft: It's as you said.
Shizuku was close to Ryo and Ikumi…
But it's not a simple relationship, like friends@or enemies…
They were close, but they couldn't fight@together.
And while they were cooling off from their@disagreements, Ikumi died…

group_1.textRight: …Miss Shizuku's wounds are deep, aren't they…
I may be digging into them with this interview…

group_1.textLeft: …It's not just about the interview…

group_1.textRight: …Is there something else bothering you…?

group_1.textLeft: At that time, I was in a place where I could do@something… But I couldn't protect Ikumi.
Surely…she must resent me.

group_1.textRight: I don't think that it was your fault…

group_1.textLeft: …I just don't have the courage…
…But even so, that doesn't mean that I should@run away…
If I have a guilty conscience…
Then I should face her properly, and be scolded.

group_1.textCenter: I'm a b-bit busy, right now…!@P-please take a seat…!

group_1.textLeft: Huh…?

group_1.textRight: Miss Shizuku…isn't here…?

group_1.textLeft: The only one working today…is her father…?

group_1.textRight: …He seems busy, too…
Should we apologize to Shizuku's father and@take our leave?
I'm worried…

group_1.textLeft: Yes… I hope everything is okay…
But now, I think that it was a good thing we@couldn't meet…

group_1.textRight: Why is that?

group_1.textLeft: I entered the shop, prepared to be yelled at@by Shizuku…
But, not being able to meet like this,@I felt uneasy…
Then, I realized…
If I were scolded by Shizuku...
Maybe I would have felt relieved.
That's not a good thing, is it…?
In the end, that, too, is self-satisfaction and@an escape from reality.

group_1.textRight: Miss Sana…?
